p: For each species, 100 unripe and ripe fruits respectively, were sampled in natural areas of the Lombardy Po plain (Fig. 1). Specifically, L. japonica was collected in the Southern part of the Lombardy Po plain at the naturalized wet area of Cassinazza di Baselica (45°12′16.1″N, 8°36′00.7″E). P. americana was sampled in the Park of Valle Lambro (45°40′11.8″N, 9°15′23.2″E), and P. serotina was collected in the Ticino Park in the North-West Lombardy (45°40′37.9″N, 8°41′02.6″E).
